a9ntdd1Pin6mSiHf4oZTxA.text: We are a group of six friends visiting from Las Vegas. Very fresh salads and amazingly good breakfast. There is something for everyone. There is a wide variety of teas. I had a macchiato which was very very good. We will probably be back for breakfast tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

15uikcROJOq--F0hfGHCdw.text: Pleasant cafe serving a decent range of hot and cold food, coffees, teas, Fritz Kola, Wostok  and other cool soft drinks.  The bean bag seating area in the rear is a nice feature and there's a shelf of books you can add to or take from whilst the main seating area is comfy and the large front window provides ample people-watching opportunities.  Space is also available on the walls for local artists to have work displayed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

wv52zRNp3WsvPoeKwYE0LA.text: I knew I'd love this place as soon as I walked through the door. It's very inviting, very modern and stylish, the staff are lovely and down to earth and the French toast is exceptional. I love the simple little touches like the backless bar stools, the fairy lights on the window, the artwork on the walls and the WiFi password on a sticker on a plant pot. I'll definitely be back.

x9QKMD92ora_oB8yiF7cew.text: I can't recommend the Early Bird strongly enough- great food, wonderful staff, and a good vibe that sets you up perfectly for the rest of the day. Our family stopped-in both mornings we were in town and each had a perfect breakfast. The staff is friendly and welcoming. This is a coffee shop- elevated. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chimney cakes were a first!
Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lovely latte

OpwN1vaRnFe6PKasrvfoig.text: Perfect little cafe to have a wee coffee and lunch or snack with a wee place to meet in the back section with some bean bags! Lovely staff as well. Nothing to fancy but modern and quaint! Try one of the stacks (the bread treat that is covered in cinnamon and looks like a chimney... yum!)

ZwcMqCTZ8JDytPd3o4I0bA.text: I had the Matcha Tea Latte and the Ham and Cheese Toastie. Everything was delicious and I loved the atmosphere. Great little cafe

photos.caption: Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Early Bird Coffee & Tea House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

dwXeJFzTkWKtHlSBDWLKvg.text: Came here a couple of times when I was in Edinburgh because I wanted to try chimney cakes. Friendly staff, excellent service, and excellent food. In addition to trying two different flavors of chimney (both fantastic), I also tried a breakfast sandwich (also really good).

fLW7qJyHBc05CJ_HHeuBLA.text: Cute little coffee and tea shop. Great drinks , yummy pastrys and comfortable seating including bean bags in the back room.

nH-ZaiddNoVETbsPVbxo7A.text: I was pleasantly surprised to see this lovely cafe as I walked past so decided to pop in for lunch.  Usually I do not like black/dark grey type decor but this place is done up tastefully and the warm bamboo tables lift the darkness of the walls and ceilings, giving it a cosy (rather than a gloomy) effect.  There is also a chilled out ok at the back with low tables, bean bags, a grass effect floor and a nice view of the garden.  The man who initially served me was friendly, helpful and informative.  I had a very nice baguette and a rather odd but still decent coffee (and the chimney cakes looked amazing).  So far, so good.  So, why only 3 stars, you ask?  Well, the woman who was working here had a seriously shitty attitude!!!  At first I thought I was imagining the dirty look I got from her so I let it slide...then I got another...I asked her a couple of questions and got a frosty/verging on rude response...I have no idea which of them is in charge but here's a tip: looking down your nose at customers is not the way to successfully run a cafe.  Trust me, I've worked all my life in customer services & customer related jobs, it seems bizarre to have to spell this out :o(  At first I was thinking about how I would recommend this place to pals, by the time I left I was thinking quite the opposite.  A real shame.
